channel.title: Trino on nanta - Data Engineering
channel.description: Recent content in Trino on nanta - Data Engineering

item.title: Trino Alluxio Cache PoC: EBS Throughput Was the Bottleneck
item.description: We ran a PoC of Trino’s Alluxio-based file system cache in a production OLAP environment. Adding the cache alone didn’t help much. The default EBS throughput of 125 MiB/s was the bottleneck. After bumping it to 1000 MiB/s, query performance improved visibly and S3 API costs dropped by ~$3,200/month.

item.title: 2026 Data Engineering Trends and Where Large-Scale Platforms Stand
item.description: Analyzing 2026 data engineering trends from Joe Reis’s 1,101-respondent survey, contrasted with our team’s current architecture at a large-scale platform. An honest look at what we’re doing well and what we need to work on.

item.title: Starburst's AI Pivot: Is Trino Open Source Going to Be Okay?
item.description: Trino open-source releases dropped 63% as Starburst pivoted from a query engine company to an AI platform. From the perspective of a team running Trino in production, here’s what this shift means and what to do about it.
